conversation.content: Слушай, я уже два часа обзваниваю всех подряд. Nobody knows anything about my paycheck.

Jefferson County. Короче, я работал три недели назад, и до сих пор ничего...

Ага ага Jefferson это—это интересно на самом деле, потому что они только что перешли с PayCore на эм... как его... на EduPay в этом семестре, твой employee ID должен начинаться либо с JC-2024, либо с TMP-SUB, какой у тебя?
TMP-SUB. И потом цифры. Блин, это такой бардак...

Это это на самом деле хорошие новости, TMP-SUB означает что ты точно в новой системе, думаю наверное что случилось—секунду дай проверю—да, проблемы с миграцией, about thirty percent of subs got stuck between systems, case number CS-9847-M, абсолютно решаемо.

HR может может может всё ещё старый портал проверяет, постоянно такое бывает, they need to look in EduPay under temporary staff not regular employees, reference code REF-TEMP-789, это типа спрятано, я могу тебе точно объяснить что им сказать?
Окей. Да. Это реально поможет. I just need to get paid, понимаешь?

Полностью полностью понимаю, так вот что говоришь, скажи им открыть EduPay, зайти в menu code M5-TEMP, потом искать по твоему TMP-SUB номеру а не по имени, наверное займёт секунды две когда они в нужном месте будут.
Menu code M5-TEMP. Понял. То есть они просто всё это время в неправильном месте искали?
В общем да, это это странная фишка с migration batch BM-2024-Q3, substitute teachers specifically got routed different, думаю может им ещё твоя первая рабочая дата понадобится, помнишь точную дату?
Четырнадцатое октября. Понедельник. Помню потому что был полный хаос с фотографированием.

Отлично отлично четырнадцатое октября, это вторая волна миграции, file code MW2-1014, ещё лучше на самом деле, because wave two has the automated catch-up feature, значит как только тебя найдут, система автоматически всю задолженность посчитает, проценты тоже.

Да да это это в контракте где-то, section 12.7.3 думаю, немного но что-то, point five percent monthly или типа того, накапливается если несколько дней работал.

original_conversation.content: Look, I've been calling around for two hours. Nobody knows anything about my paycheck.

Okay okay okay let me—let me help you figure this out, substitute teachers can be tricky tricky because you might be in system A4-DIST or maybe the county portal B7-EDU depending on when you started, what district are you with?
Jefferson County. So basically I worked three weeks ago and still nothing...

Right right Jefferson that's—that's interesting actually because they just switched from PayCore to um... what's the... to EduPay this semester, your employee ID should start with either JC-2024 or TMP-SUB, which one do you have?
TMP-SUB. And then the numbers. God, this is such a mess...

That's that's actually good news though, TMP-SUB means you're definitely in the new system, I think probably what happened is—hold on let me check—yeah migration issues, about thirty percent of subs got stuck between systems, case number CS-9847-M, super fixable.
Fixable? Really? Because HR said they couldn't even find me in the system.

HR might might might be checking the old portal still, happens all the time, they need to look in EduPay under temporary staff not regular employees, reference code REF-TEMP-789, it's kinda hidden, I can walk you through exactly what to tell them?
Okay. Yeah. That would actually help. I just need to get paid, you know?

Totally totally get it, so here's what you say, tell them to open EduPay, go to menu code M5-TEMP, then search by your TMP-SUB number not your name, probably takes like two seconds once they're in the right spot.
Menu code M5-TEMP. Got it. So basically they've just been looking in the wrong place this whole time?

Pretty much yeah, it's it's a weird quirk with the migration batch BM-2024-Q3, substitute teachers specifically got routed different, I think maybe they'll need your first work date too, do you remember the exact date?
October fourteenth. Monday. I remember because it was picture day chaos.

Perfect perfect October fourteenth, that's wave two of the migration, file code MW2-1014, even better actually because wave two has the automated catch-up feature, means once they find you the system calculates all the back pay automatically, interest too.
Interest? They pay interest on late checks? That's... huh. Okay.
Yeah yeah it's it's in the contract somewhere, section 12.7.3 I think, not much but something, point five percent monthly or whatever, adds up though if you worked multiple days.
Three full weeks. So that's something at least. You've been really helpful actually.

Good good glad I could—I mean substitute teachers get the runaround constantly, it's kinda ridiculous, but now you have all the codes, M5-TEMP, MW2-1014, your TMP-SUB number, should be sorted sorted sorted quick.
Yeah, I'm calling them right after this. Thanks for actually listening and figuring it out.

No problem honestly this stuff's like a weird puzzle and I kinda love figuring out which system ate someone's paycheck, call back if they give you trouble, reference this case CS-9847-M and I'll know exactly where we left off okay?

scenario: substitute teacher, confused about which payroll system she should contact about missing wages
